main event: A bright stationary light in the southwest sky was observed over a 3 hour period in Longmont, Colorado.
interesting points: The light appeared to be of uniform brightness and color, remaining stationary except for minor fluctuations in intensity.
No definite shape could be determined, but at times the object appeared to flare up and then dim down.
The object was also observed by several other witnesses in the area.
Based on the description, the object is considered to be an astronomical (optical) phenomenon, possibly a star or planet.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force, who requested more information to analyze the case.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
